name: GoJS
comment: GoJS is commercial, but some of the examples are cool, like the org-chart editor.

name: Cytoscape
comment: Cytoscape looks great. It has good data models, nice interaction, event binding, and could be a serious contender, but it uses LGPL.

name: networkD3
comment: Has Sankey diagrams, and R, but not useful otherwise.

name: vis.js
comment: Very nice looking, one drawback, is that it doesn't seem to support user layout. Also modal editing.

name: The Grid
comment: Used by no-flo project.  Kind of awesome, also confusing. Might do some of what we want, but hard to say

name: MindMup MapJS
comment: MindMup is mind mapping software. MapJS is the graph part. AutoLayout, not for us.

name: JointJS
comment: JointJS is a diagramming library. It has some good demos, but the API seems complicated. This library is part of commercial productm, and has a Mozilla License.

name: JsPlumb
comment: This looks like a well maintained library. Has good event support,
